alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Granville; Vance; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Vance, western Warren, east central Granville and northwestern Franklin Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Oxford to Henderson to near Kittrell. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, cloud to ground lightning, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Henderson, Warrenton, Norlina, Kittrell, Middleburg, Ingleside, Gillburg, Afton, Steele Creek Marina & Campground and Kerr Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
